title: Sapiens: A Brief History of Humankind
author: Yuval Noah Harari
description: Explores the history of humankind from the Stone Age to the modern age, highlighting how shared beliefs shaped societies.

title: Atomic Habits
author: James Clear
description: A guide on how small, consistent habits can compound into life-changing results through proven strategies and frameworks.

title: The Power of Now
author: Eckhart Tolle
description: Focuses on mindfulness and living in the present moment as the key to spiritual enlightenment and peace.

title: Deep Work
author: Cal Newport
description: Discusses the benefits of focused, distraction-free work and strategies to maximize productivity and creativity.

title: Thinking, Fast and Slow
author: Daniel Kahneman
description: Explains the two systems of thinking: fast, intuitive responses and slow, deliberate reasoning, and how they shape decisions.

title: The Lean Startup
author: Eric Ries
description: Introduces the lean startup methodology to build and scale businesses using rapid experimentation and customer feedback.

title: Can’t Hurt Me
author: David Goggins
description: An autobiography of Navy SEAL David Goggins, showing how discipline and mental toughness can overcome obstacles.

title: Zero to One
author: Peter Thiel
description: Explores how to create groundbreaking startups that build unique products and shape the future economy.

title: Man’s Search for Meaning
author: Viktor E. Frankl
description: A Holocaust survivor’s memoir and psychological exploration of finding purpose even in suffering.

title: The 7 Habits of Highly Effective People
author: Stephen R. Covey
description: Provides timeless principles for personal and professional effectiveness, focusing on proactive behavior and leadership.
